intro: Dorstenia rosenii, commonly known as the Rosens' false banana, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves that resemble the fronds of a fern. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Dorstenia rosenii is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate to bright indirect light.
